title: PL/I Basics
description: Learn the fundamentals of PL/I programming.

theory.content:
Welcome to the Introduction chapter of PL/I Basics.

PL/I (Programming Language One) is a procedural, imperative computer programming language designed for scientific, engineering, business and system programming uses. It has been used by various academic, commercial and industrial organizations since it was introduced in the 1960s.

In this chapter, you'll learn the basic syntax, data types, and fundamental concepts of PL/I programming.

exercise.instructions: Write a PL/I program that declares two variables, assigns values to them, and displays their sum.
exercise.hint: Use DCL for declarations, assignment statements, and PUT SKIP LIST for output.

theory.content:
In this Core Concepts chapter, we'll dive deeper into PL/I programming.

You'll learn about arrays, loops, conditionals, and other essential programming constructs that form the backbone of PL/I development.

exercise.instructions: Create a PL/I program that uses a loop to fill an array with values and then displays them.
exercise.hint: Use DO loops and array indexing.

theory.content:
Advanced Topics covers more complex PL/I programming techniques.

This chapter explores advanced data structures, string manipulation, file handling, and best practices for writing maintainable PL/I code.

exercise.instructions: Write a PL/I program that works with strings, calculates the length, and displays it.
exercise.hint: Use CHAR data type and LENGTH function.
